newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish KPW approves Commerzbank rise of BRE stake.
newsitem.headline: Polish KPW approves Commerzbank rise of BRE stake.

text.p: The Polish Securities Commission (KPW) said on Thursday it had approved an aquisition of 11.9 percent of Bank Rozwoju Exportu (BRE) by Germany's Commerzbank.
This will raise Commerzbank's holding in the Polish bank to 32.9 percent.

"The KPW did not oppose the aquisition by Commerzbank of a stake exceeding 25 percent and reaching 32.9 percent of all votes at the general shareholders meeting of Bank Rozwoju Exportu," a KPW statement released on Thursday said.
Commerzbank currently has a 21 percent holding in BRE.

It was not immediately clear whether Commerzbank would buy existing BRE shares or take up a new issue. The KPW gave no further deatils and neither BRE nor Commerzbank officials were immediately available for comment.
